verbs.description: salinize (third-person singular simple present salinizes, present participle salinizing, simple past and past participle salinized)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) to become or render salty
examples: Salinized drinking water probably is the best insurance that the men will take the salt during the working hours of the day. A study from the Inland Steel Company56, in which a section of steel workers, 3,000 men, were given salinized drinking water, 0·1 per cent., showed good results as compared with the control group.
